issue.title: basic_string::at should not have a Requires clause

discussion.p: basic_string::at() has a wide contract and should not have a "Requires" clause on it.
This issue would also apply to every member function of basic_string that throws out_of_range, and to some cases where a length_error can be thrown.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N3376.

blockquote.pre: const_reference at(size_type pos) const; reference at(size_type pos);

blockquote.p:
-5- Requires: pos < size()
-6- Throws: out_of_range if pos >= size().
-7- Returns: operator[](pos).
